result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E. Eisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim and be preapproved by  probation.  Defendant must successfully complete his two years of probation.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the State, the court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of two years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate.  Defendant shall register with the sex offender registry.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender evaluation and treatment as recommended.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  Jail sentence is to begin immediately.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Concurrent with: Sentence defendant is currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall have no contact with females under the age of 18.

Defendant shall have a sex offender assessment.  Defendant shall undergo sex offender therapy.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Days Credit Worksheet

Defendant Joseph E. Eisner in court with attorney Ronald K Colwell.  Defendant Joseph E. Eisner in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with.   Attorney Colwell has received the revocation packet and states inaccuracies of the packet to the court.  Argument by counsel regarding sentencing.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders 2 years prison with 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision with conditions of no contact with females under the age of 18; unpaid financial obligations are to be paid; sex offender assessment and therapy; sex offender registry; counseling as deemed appropriate.  Defendant is not eligible for the challenge incarceration program and substance abuse program.  Court orders 464 days sentence credit.  - rt

Defendant Joseph E. Eisner in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court would like the judgment of conviction be amended in Case No. 15CM2.  No objection by the parties.   Judgment of conviction to be amended that the defendant must have a sex offender evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.  Court then accepts the deferred entry of judgment for Case No. 15CF7 for a period of two years.  Court signs the Order. - rt
Adjourned plea hearing at 07-23-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Joseph E. Eisner in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest to count 1 in 15CM2 and plea of no contest in Count 1  in 15CF7.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Statement by DA, Victim's mother and Attorney Nocco.  Court dismisses and read in counts 2 and 3 in 15CM2.  Court finds defendant guilty in Case No. 15CM2 and orders withheld sentence probation for 2 years with conditions of court costs; DNA surcharge; 60 days county jail with huber to begin no later than September 2, 2015 at 4:30 pm; no contact with victim; letter of apology to victim due within 30 days after sentencing and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at discretion of probation.  In Case No. 15CF7 the court order is not accepting the deferred agreement at this time and will be scheduling this for another hearing.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  - rt
